title: Add configuration option to disable the sky in Gazebo

content.raw:
Currently, the only way to disable the sky (which causes problems on some machines http://answers.gazebosim.org/question/4703/how-to-disable-skyx/?answer=4880#post-id-4880) is to disable it in the source code and re-compile gazebo. Could this be made into an option that can be specified in the SDF? 

I'd do it, but the path between SDF `.world` configuration file and `Scene::SetSky` is complicated to figure out without being familiar with the codebase. 

Not that this does not require #693 because it would be configured before a world is created.

Additionally, this is important for doing free-flying space simulations where machine vision is involved and we want a dark black environment. For now, disabling the sky is good enough for this.
